intro: Plectronia kohenua var. orbiculata, commonly known as the Kona orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to Hawaii. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, coastal habitats and thrives in well-drained soil. It has narrow, strap-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
